result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J Bowring

records.addlTxt:
2:18 PM Defendant Timothy J Bowring in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Timothy J Bowring.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Defense requests adjournment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 2, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:44 PM Defendant Timothy J Bowring in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.  
Defense requests time to finalize restitution and get a global resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:51 AM Defendant Timothy J Bowring in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Menden requests this be set for plea and sentencing for the same date as defendants other case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Eryn Menden

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Check Into Cash listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:47 AM Defendant Timothy J Bowring in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 05/25/22022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
